location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. File notes appear at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover and terminates at the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file concerns the possible appointment of a vice-consul at Dhahran [al-Ẓahrān] by the Government of India. Correspondents in the file include Lieutenant-Colonel William Rupert Hay, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bahrain; Cornelius James Pelly, the Political Agent at Bahrain; and Lloyd Moore, Resident Manager of the Arabian American Oil Company (Aramco), Bahrain. In a letter, dated 4 April 1947, Hay enquires as to the extent of Indian interests at Dhahran and the number of Indians employed by Aramco. In a letter, dated 23 April 1947, Moore informs Pelly that there are 638 Indian employees of Aramco at Dhahran as of 31 March 1947. This is compared to 475 on 1 June 1946.
